tool.name: Canyon-B
tool.description: estimation of ocean CO2 variables and nutrient concentrations
tool.command:
mkdir input/ && cp '$input_data' 'input/$input_data.element_identifier' &&
#if $mapping.type == 'no': Rscript '$__tool_directory__/run_tool_canyonb.R' 'input/$input_data.element_identifier' #else: Rscript '$__tool_directory__/run_tool_canyonb.R' 'input/$input_data.element_identifier' '$mapping.mapping_pres' '$mapping.mapping_temp' '$mapping.mapping_psal' '$mapping.mapping_doxy' '$mapping.mapping_epres' '$mapping.mapping_etemp' '$mapping.mapping_epsal' '$mapping.mapping_edoxy' #end if

param.name: input_data
param.label: Input a csv or txt file

param.name: type
param.label: Do you have your own mapping to make ?
param.help: The mapping is needed for ODV collection extracted from the ODV software.
param.option: No, the mapping is already correct in my data
Yes, I have to make a mapping

param.name: mapping_temp
param.label: Column name of the in-situ temperature

param.name: mapping_doxy
param.label: Column name of the dissolved oxygen

param.name: mapping_epres
param.label: Column name of the default value for input errors pressure (optional)

param.name: mapping_etemp
param.label: Column name of the default value for input errors temperature (optional)

param.name: mapping_epsal
param.label: Column name of the default value for input errors salinity (optional)

param.name: mapping_edoxy
param.label: Column name of the default value for input errors dissolved oxygen (optional)
param.help: 1 % of dissolved oxygen (This is a rather optimistic default, meant for GO-SHIP quality bottle data. A reasonable default sensor dissolved oxgyen error would be 3 % of doxy (or higher!).)

tool.help:
======================= Canyon-B Neural Network =======================
**What it does**
Robust Estimation of Open Ocean CO2 Variables and Nutrient Concentrations From T, S, and O2 Data Using Bayesian Neural Networks.
CANYON-B calculation according to Bittig et al. (2018): Bayesian neural network mapping of NO3, PO4, SiOH4, AT, CT, pH or pCO2 for any set of water column P, T, S, O2, location data as an alternative to (spatial) climatological interpolation. Based on GLODAPv2/GO-SHIP bottle data This tool runs canyon B on multi profiles !
**Input description**
Mandatory a txt or csv file to be processed .csv built by the user with : separator ";" mandatory column name : date/latitude/longitude/temperature/salinity/oxygen optional column name for error: epre/etemp/epsal/edoxy
or
.txt built by the tools QCV-ingestor-harmonizer then QCV-odv-tool
If you have to make your own mapping which means you have an extracted .txt from the (web)ODV software (from ODV) - Mandatory name of the column pressure, temperature, salinity and oxygen - Optional name of the column error for pres, temp, sal and oxy
*Important* : canyon B reads : latitude [-90 to 90°N] longitude [-180 to 180°E] pressure in dbar temperature in °C salinity in psu oxygen in µmol/kg
**Output**
Input csv or txt enriched with canyonb output including their errors: - NO3 (nitrate) - PO4 (phosphate) - AT (total alkalinity) - CT (total carbon) - pH (ph) - pCO2 (pCO2) - SiOH4 (silicate) The output is visible with `ODV <https://earth-system.usegalaxy.eu/root?tool_id=interactive_tool_odv>`
For more information read https://github.com/HCBScienceProducts/CANYON-B/blob/master/CANYONB.R
